author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of the Makkal Nala Paniyalargal staging a protest demanding re-instatement of dismissed government employees in Tiruchi on Wednesday.— PHOTO: M. SRINATH

As many as 280 Makkal Nala Paniyalargal, including 68 women, were arrested here on Wednesday after they resorted to picketing agitation demanding their reinstatement.

The workers assembled at Chinthamani where they staged a demonstration in support of their demand. Police sources said permission was granted for the demonstration.

However, the Makkal Nala Paniyalargal sat on the road demanding the State government to reinstate them as per High Court direction.

One of the demonstrators Jyothi created a flutter by attempting to immolate herself after pouring kerosene over her.

The police prevented the demonstrator from carrying on with her act causing tense moments for sometime.

The police arrested the demonstrators at the spot. The demonstration was led by the Makkal Nala Paniyalargal Munnetra Sangam state president Mathivanan.
